subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Scamp,
author: Fransen, Debbie
full_text:
--_000_AB3E6B5188566C488E011B9C54CF2A1806126E9422satlrccdlmb60_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

RJ, it is very obvious that you are not here for the same reasons we are. W=
e are trying to prove something we know, and
you are trying to disprove it =
.
Why don't we all just ignore him from now on and not reply to anything he=
 says and maybe he will go away.....
Bye RJ. You are just not in the group =
that you need to be in....


________________________________
From: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Rj
Sent: Sun=
day, August 22, 2010 6:17 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EVP-=
ITC] Scamp,



I realize you have plenty of subjective anecdotal evidence.I=
 don't consider that 'hard evidence' however.  I am looking for something a=
 little more objective and less subject to influence and interpretations.

=
And stop putting words in my mouth. A person can misinterpret something, mi=
stake something, or confuse something, without lying about something.  And =
before you jump down my throat claiming I am saying all results are mistake=
s, I am not.  I am performing experiments, keeping an open mind, and consid=
ering all evidence I find.

The way you have been attacking me by calling m=
e names at every turn, just because I try new things and don't always agree=
 with your world view, is eerily reminiscent of the way the church of old t=
ried to suppress new thought and discoveries, except you're just substituti=
ng the word 'heretic' with 'science'. and 'blasphemy' with anything that di=
sagrees with you.

There's an old saying:  "We become that which we hate". =
 So far, all you've done is denounce people's efforts to try new methods an=
d see what works.  You accept nothing anyone else proposes if it does not a=
gree with you.  That is the realm of the extreme skeptic: the same skeptic =
you ridicule.

You certainly don't have to agree with my comments.  And I d=
on't have to agree with yours.  But no one needs all the name calling Frank=
.   It really adds nothing to support your theories.



--- On Sun, 8/22/10=
, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

From: Frank Sumption <=
purplealiengirl@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Scamp,
To: EVP-ITC@yahoog=
roups.com
Date: Sunday, August 22, 2010, 2:15 PM



 Yeah I know, science n=
o accept anecdotes. There is plenty of hard evidence, trouble, science don'=
t accept that either cuz they are taught, no spirits, so there are no sprit=
 voices, fact is fact is facts. Well that's about all there is in this fiel=
d. Perhaps you should take bird watching or something concrete. To not acce=
pt what others say is the same as calling us all liars, and I find very ins=
ulting.

 How irrational is it to ignore all evidence and continuously try =
to fit the phenomon into a diffintion where it will not fit and does not be=
long, and then claim you're looking for a more rational explantation, it ju=
st does not make sense. I say forget the BS "science" whatever that is, put=
s out and try thinking on your own.  Mr Spock was a fictional charactor!

 =
F-S



On Sun, Aug 22, 2010 at 7:20 AM, Rj <rasterer@...</mc/compose?=
to=3Drasterer@...>> wrote:


Experimental data in controlled conditio=
ns, and personal anecdotes, are not the same thing,



--- On Sun, 8/22/10,=
 Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...</mc/compose?to=3Dpurplealiengirl=
@...>> wrote:

From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...</mc/co=
mpose?to=3Dpurplealiengirl@...>>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Scamp,
To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.com</mc/compose?to=3DEVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
Date: Sunda=
y, August 22, 2010, 12:21 AM




 If you completely ignore what everyone el=
se in the whole wide freaking world gets via EVP, various photography and I=
TC methods, and just chance encounters, then yeah, you probably don't have =
any data, and won't have any data no matter what.

F-S

On Sat, Aug 21, 201=
0 at 3:42 PM, Rick Wegrzyn <rickwegrzyn@...<http://mc/compose?to=3Dri=
ckwegrzyn@...>> wrote:


Hey RJ,I think we need to go to the cemetary=
 and see what you get there....

________________________________
From: Rj =
<rasterer@...<http://mc/compose?to=3Drasterer@...>>

To: EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.com<http://mc/compose?to=3DEVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sat=
, August 21, 2010 2:29:36 PM

Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Scamp,



I don't thin=
k I have enough data yet to make any conclusions, so I plan more experiment=
s.  Since there are different distinct claims about what the box or the rec=
orders can do, I try to make different distinct experiments for each.

Some=
 people claim they can get the box to tell them things that the operator co=
uldn't know, so my "whats the object" experiment is one way to examine that=
.  Some people claim the boxes can make predictions, so cataloging predicti=
ons and examining the results can help examine that.  If there are other cl=
aims, I will try to figure experiments based on those.

--- On Sat, 8/21/10=
, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...<http://mc/compose?to=3Dpurpleal=
iengirl@...>> wrote:

From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...=
<http://mc/compose?to=3Dpurplealiengirl@...>>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] =
Scamp,
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<http://mc/compose?to=3DEVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps.com>
Date: Saturday, August 21, 2010, 12:48 PM



 I get our last dogs f=
rom time to time, and used to get them via white noise when I first started=
 this. Last summer some kids came down into the basement wiht the younger g=
randson, and the little yorkie barked, but "get outta here" came out, some =
how.

 Yeah, I think I was too hard on RJ. I don't know why, but testing do=
ens't seem to work, but we get enough to prove this to ourselves. It's prob=
ably a faith thing, although I'm not religious, even anti-religion.

 F-S

=



On Fri, Aug 20, 2010 at 6:27 PM, <SnowfireL@...> wrote:

[Attachment=
(s)<https://mail.google.com/mail/?ui=3D2&view=3Djs&name=3Dmain,tlist&ver=3D=
9oD1J7yvz5o.en.&am=3D%21xONyw1plirqxhZ4a1PIWg1xlTveuJ8oWIzqJ6mz0Dt83ht4Zrp4=
&fri#12a920b21a6295da_TopText> from SnowfireL@... included below]

Here=
 is a short file, where someone says, "Scamp, Scamp," then Scamp barks. "ya=
p."  This little dog belonged to my grandma, when I was about 9 or 10 years=
 old, he was a Manchester Terrier, and lived with us for many years, and th=
is is his bark for sure.  I'd know that bark anywhere.  Sorry, that I can't=
 make it any clearer, I need to get one of those better ghost boxes I guess=
.  RJ, spirits are just like us, they are not omnipresent like God,  probab=
ly why David doesn't want to play the guessing game, he has better things t=
o do over there, and has said, they have thousands of people standing in th=
is long line waiting to get into the Heavens, and He can't just drop His jo=
b and go to your house to see what you have over there, He did tell me that=
 first time what it was, and i sent it to you, but it was too late.  It's h=
ard for me to understand them sometimes, He was also right about that littl=
e boy, Syler being killed, and where his body would be found, I don't know =
what they did about it though. sf
